result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joseph D Deang was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 48 mo.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $2327  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit DOES apply. Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.

Status conference at 10-26-2015 01:30 pm

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.  
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $5000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 11

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
